Ordinary Least Squares Model Formulation

Source: R/doc-models.R
var_design_formulation.Rd

This page specifies the formulation for ordinary least squares (OLS) that VAR-family model. Notation and format here will be used in this entire package document.

Vector Autoregressive Model

As mentioned in var_lm(), we specify VAR(p) model by $$Y_t = A_1 Y_{t - 1} + \cdots + A_p Y_{t - p} + c + \epsilon_t$$ Consider sample of T size, \(y_1, \ldots, y_n\). Let \(n = T - p\). \(y_1, \ldots, y_T\) data are rearranged as follows. $$Y_j = (y_j, y_{j + 1}, \ldots, y_{j + n - 1})^\intercal$$ and \(Z_j = (\epsilon_j, \epsilon_{j + 1}, \ldots, \epsilon_{j + n - 1})^\intercal\) For ordinary least squares (OLS) estimation, we define each response matrix and design matrix in multivariate OLS as follows. First, response matrix: $$Y_0 = Y_{p + 1}$$ Next, design matrix: $$X_0 = [Y_p, \ldots, Y_1, 1]$$ Then we now have OLS model $$Y_0 = X_0 A + Z_0$$ where \(Z_0 = Z_{p + 1}\) Here, $$A = [A_1, A_2, \ldots, A_p, c]^T$$ This gives that $$\hat{A} = (X_0^\intercal X_0)^{-1} X_0^\intercal Y_0$$

Vector Heterogeneous Autoregressive Model

  • VHAR model is linearly restricted VAR(22).

  • Let \(Y_0 = X_1 \Phi + Z_0\) be the OLS formula of VHAR.

  • Let \(T_0\) be 3m x 22m matrix.

$$ C_0 = \begin{bmatrix} 1 & 0 & 0 & 0 & 0 & 0 & \cdots & 0 \\ 1 / 5 & 1 / 5 & 1 / 5 & 1 / 5 & 1 / 5 & 0 & \cdots & 0 \\ 1 / 22 & 1 / 22 & 1 / 22 & 1 / 22 & 1 / 22 & 1 / 22 & \cdots & 1 / 22 \end{bmatrix} \otimes I_m $$

Define (3m + 1) x (22m + 1) matrix \(C_{HAR}\) by $$ C_{HAR} = \begin{bmatrix} C_0 & 0_{3m} \\ 0_{3m}^\intercal & 1 \end{bmatrix} $$

Then by construction, $$Y_0 = X_1 \Phi + Z_0 = (X_0 C_{HAR}^\intercal) \Phi + Z_0$$ i.e. $$X_1 = X_0 C_{HAR}^\intercal$$

It follows that $$\hat\Phi = (X_1^\intercal X_1)^{-1} X_1^\intercal Y_0$$

References

Baek, C. and Park, M. (2021). Sparse vector heterogeneous autoregressive modeling for realized volatility. J. Korean Stat. Soc. 50, 495–510.

Bubák, V., Kočenda, E., & Žikeš, F. (2011). Volatility transmission in emerging European foreign exchange markets. Journal of Banking & Finance, 35(11), 2829–2841.

Corsi, F. (2008). A Simple Approximate Long-Memory Model of Realized Volatility. Journal of Financial Econometrics, 7(2), 174–196.

Lütkepohl, H. (2007). New Introduction to Multiple Time Series Analysis. Springer Publishing.
